document.ModsDocTitle: New Curculionoidea (Coleoptera) records for Quebec, Canada
document.docAuthor: Tonnancour, Pierre de, Anderson, Robert S., Bouchard, Patrice, Chantal, Claude, Dumont, Stephane & Vigneault, Robert
document.masterDocTitle: New Curculionoidea (Coleoptera) records for Quebec, Canada

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Curculionoidea (Coleoptera) records for Quebec, Canada

taxonomicName.authority: LeConte, 1876, new data supporting first record for Quebec

paragraph.taxonomicName: Choragus sayi LeConte, 1876, new data supporting first record for Quebec

subSubSection.paragraph: Species identification confirmed by RSA, 2015 and 2016

Bousquet et al. (2013) recorded this species from Quebec without any further comment, possibly on the basis of a vague record ("Quebec to Georgia west to Indiana and Texas") by Valentine (1998) . This small species is strongly saltatorial and can be difficult to catch in hot weather. We provide, for the first time, data on the occurrence of this species in the province.

[ Agglomeration de Longueuil] Longueuil, 18VII1992, C. Chantal (1, CCCH); [MRC Marguerite-d'Youville ] Varennes, 16VII1999, attracted to UV light, C.
